reasoning: Periventricular leukomalacia primarily affects premature infants <34 weeks gestation, with estimated incidence ~6.5 per 100k person-years accounting for global preterm birth rates (~10%) and PVL prevalence in preterm neonates (~5-7%). Confidence moderate due to limited large-scale population-based incidence studies; primarily documented through neonatal and cerebral palsy registries.
source: Neonatal registries and cerebral palsy epidemiological studies
